name: swish
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to (cause to) move quickly through the air making a soft sound: I heard the rope swish through the air. The horses swished their tails to get rid of the flies hovering around them. Synonym
swoosh informal

swish noun [C]
(MOVEMENT)
a quick movement through the air, making a soft sound: With a swish of the curtains, the stage was revealed. Synonym
swoosh (SOUND) informal

to move quickly through the air making a high, soft sound, or to cause something to move this way: [ I ] The elevator doors swished open. [ T ] Vizard swished the ball through the hoop. swish noun [ C ] us

/swɪʃ/
the swish of tires on wet pavement
